authoring.answerwidget.answer.answerRang: Enter min and max values separated by a comma. Use a bracket to include the number next to it in the range, or a parenthesis to exclude the number. For example, to identify the correct answers as 5, 6, or 7, but not 8, specify [5,8).

Aucune réponse correcte n'a été spécifiée.

A discrepancy was found between the settings defined in the OLX's problem tag and the
      settings selected in the sidebar. The settings defined in the OLX's problem tag will be saved and
      corresponding values in the sidebar will be discarded.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.advance: Définir une valeur par défaut dans les paramètres avancés
authoring.problemeditor.settings.reset.t: Determines whether a 'Reset' button is shown so the user may reset their answer, generally for use in practice or formative assessments.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.scoring: Spécifiez la pondération des points et le nombre de tentatives de réponse
Si aucune valeur n'est définie, des tentatives illimitées sont autorisées
Si aucune valeur n'est définie, le problème vaut un point
authoring.problemeditor.settings.showAns: Définissez quand les apprenants peuvent voir la bonne réponse.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.timer.t: Seconds a student must wait between submissions for a problem with multiple attempts.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.switcht: If you use the advanced editor, this problem will be converted to OLX and you will not be able to return to the simple editor.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.showAns: Fournissez une explication pour la bonne réponse.
authoring.problemeditor.settings.general: Enter the feedback to appear when a student submits a wrong answer. This will be overridden if you add answer-specific feedback.

authoring.videoeditor.license.title: Licence
authoring.videoeditor.license.add.label: Add a license for this video
authoring.videoeditor.license.deleteLice: Clear and apply the course-level license
authoring.videoeditor.license.courseLeve: This license currently set at the course level
authoring.videoeditor.license.courseLice: Licenses set at the course level appear at the bottom of courseware pages within your course.
authoring.videoeditor.license.libraryLev: This license currently set at the library level
authoring.videoeditor.license.libraryLic: Licenses set at the library level appear at the specific library video.
authoring.videoeditor.license.defaultLev: This license is set specifically for this video
authoring.videoeditor.license.defaultLic: When a video has a different license than the course as a whole, learners see the license at the bottom right of the video player.
authoring.videoeditor.license.attributio: Allow others to copy, distribute, display and perform your copyrighted work but only if they give credit the way you request. Currently, this option is required.
authoring.videoeditor.license.noncommerc: Allow others to copy, distribute, display and perform your work - and derivative works based upon it - but for noncommercial purposes only.
authoring.videoeditor.license.noDerivati: Allow others to copy, distribute, display and perform only verbatim copies of your work, not derivative works based upon it. This option is incompatible with "Share Alike".
authoring.videoeditor.license.shareAlike: Allow others to distribute derivative works only under a license identical to the license that governs your work. This option is incompatible with "No Derivatives".
authoring.videoeditor.license.allRightsR: Vous réservez tous les droits sur votre travail.

authoring.videoeditor.videoSource.videoU:
The URL for your video. This can be a YouTube URL, or a link
    to an .mp4, .ogg, or .webm video file hosted elsewhere on the internet.
authoring.videoeditor.videoIdChangeAlert: The Video ID field has changed, please check the Video URL and fallback URL values and update them if necessary.
authoring.videoeditor.videoSource.fallba:
To be sure all learners can access the video, edX
    recommends providing additional videos in both .mp4 and
    .webm formats.  The first listed video compatible with the
    learner's device will play.
authoring.videoeditor.videoSource.allowD:
Allow learners to download versions of this video in
    different formats if they cannot use the edX video player or do not have
    access to YouTube.
authoring.videoeditor.videoSource.allowV: Allow this video to be shared on social media.

Allow learners to share this video publicly on social media.
    The video will be viewable by anyone, they will not need to enroll in the course
    or even have an edX account. Links to the course about page and to enroll in the 
    course will appear alongside the video.
